This enzyme can reduce either Ubiquinone or Menaquinone. Because no ubiquinone was found in Hpylori menaquinone 6 is used here. In the Kegg database, the NADPH Quinone Reductase catalyze an one electron reduction of quinones but in Wang and Maier, 2004, Infection and Immunity, they say that it is a two-electron transfere. Therefore no EC number is entered. IT (06-01-2004)

notes.html:p: Equation: [c] : cys-L + dxyl + tyr-L --> 4hba + 4mhetz + co2 + h + h2o + nh4 + pyr

Equation: [c] : atp + thymd --> adp + dtmp + h
Equation: [c] : dump + fmnh2 + mlthf --> dtmp + fmn + thf
IT (06-15-04) Ref: Myllykallio et al. 2002, Science, 297. this enzyme uses mlthf as an one-carbon source and FMNH2 or FADH2 as electron acceptor.
Equation: [c] : h + nadph + trdox --> nadp + trdrd
GENE ASSOCIATION: (HP0824 and HP1458) and (HP0825 and HP1164)

A pyridoxal-phosphate protein. Also catalyses the conversion of serine and indole into tryptophan and water, and of indoleglycerol phosphate into indole and glyceraldehyde phosphate (the latter reaction was listed formerly as EC 4.1.2.8).

Equation: [c] : gam1p + h + utp --> ppi + ugam
tv This rxn is not biochemically verified. It's assumed to be the net of UAGDP+G1PACT without the acylation step bc H. pylori's Lipid A is not acylated at the N position.
Equation: [c] : uacgam + uagmda --> h + uaagmda + udp
